title: 111_hr3578
content: The "Everyone Deserves Unconditional Access to Education (EDUCATE) Act" may be cited as the short title. This Act includes an amendment to IDEA. Section 611(i) of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (20 U.S.C. 1411(i)) is amended to allocate funding for fiscal year 2010, with specific amounts authorized for different purposes. For fiscal years 2011 and 2012, specific amounts are appropriated for education funding, with varying percentages allocated for each year. The funds are available for obligation on specific dates and remain accessible until the end of the following fiscal year. In fiscal years 2013 and 2014, specific amounts are appropriated for education funding, with varying percentages allocated for each year. The funds become available for obligation on specific dates and remain accessible until the end of the following fiscal year. In fiscal years 2013 and 2014, specific amounts are appropriated for education funding, with varying percentages allocated for each year. The funds become available for obligation on specific dates and remain accessible until the end of the following fiscal year. For fiscal year 2014, $30,247,123,000 or 40 percent of the determined amount is appropriated, while for fiscal year 2015, $18,741,912,000 or 22.5 percent is allocated. Starting from fiscal year 2016, 40 percent of the determined amount is appropriated annually. In fiscal years 2013 and 2014, specific amounts are appropriated for education funding, with varying percentages allocated for each year. For fiscal year 2016 and onwards, 40 percent of the determined amount is appropriated, minus $11,505,211,000, becoming available on July 1 of each fiscal year and remaining accessible until September 30 of the following fiscal year. The text chunk discusses the funding allocation for special education and related services for children aged 3 through 21 in all States, based on per-pupil expenditure in public schools in the United States. SEC. 3. OFFSETS. The amounts appropriated in 611(i) of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act shall be expended consistent with pay-as-you-go requirements.
